result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew D Joles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Prisoner Throw/Expel Bodily Substances, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.43(2m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Joles, Matthew D

records.addlTxt:
1:36 PM Defendant Matthew D Joles in court, in custody with the Vilas County Jail.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 22CF22 and 22CF77. Court notes defendant is pro se. Court provides the copy of the letter dated Sept 6 from DA Karl Hayes outlining the hearing for today.  Defendant acknowledges paperwork. Victim rights complied with. No victim appearing today. Court goes over the waiver to counsel. Attorney rights given. Defendant is voluntarily and freely waiving his right to an attorney. Defendant Joles pleads guilty in 22CF22 and defendant Joles pleads guilty to 22CF77. 
Defendant gives the Court two plea questionnaires for each case. Court speaks to those questionnaires. 
Court accepts the plea agreement.  Felony advisements given. State speaks to sentencing. Defendant makes a statement to the court and reads letter. Court speaks. 

Court finds defendant guilty on count one for 22CF22. Court imposes: 4 years in WPS with 4 years extended supervision, 217 days credit. Eligible for ERP and CIP. Conditions of probation are AODA, maintain absolute sobriety, any treatment deemed necessary, follow all recommendations set forth by probation, full time employment or education. Court costs in the amount of $518.00 payable within 60 days to the Clerk of Courts Office and a payment plan. 

Court finds defendant guilty on count one in 22CF77.  Court imposes: 1.5 years in WPS with 2 years extended super CONCURRENT to 22CF22 with 113 days credit. Eligible for ERP and CIP. Conditions of probation are AODA, maintain absolute sobriety, any treatment deemed necessary, follow all recommendations set forth by probation, full time employment or education and anger management deemed necessary. Court costs in the amount of $518.00 payable within 60 days to the Clerk of Courts Office and a payment plan. 

Court provided the Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  Defendant was advised to review, sign and return if he so choses.

9:59 AM Defendant Matthew D Joles in court, in custody Vilas County Jail and pro se .  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights legislation has been complied with. Defendant wishes to withdraw any and all motions and requests to move to plea and sentencing. Plea questioner handed to defendant by clerk. Advised to review and complete at time of plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Motion hearing on September 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:07 PM Defendant Matthew D Joles in court, in custody, prose.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights legislation has been complied with. Defendant and ADA attempting to reach an agreement on this case. ADA Brown to get back to defendant on counter offer. Bond continued.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

3:08 PM Defendant Matthew D Joles in court, in custody.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Information printed and provided to defendant in court.  Defendant provided time to read information.  Defendant waives reading.  Not guilty plea entered.  Defendant's written motions heard by the Court.  Court authorizes numbers listed on motion. Motion re: back up attorney or paralegal; denied by Court. No contact provisions will not be modified by the Court.    Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:10 AM Defendant Matthew D Joles in court, in custody.  ADA Dennis Brown appears in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised that public defender's office has made 6 contacts for appointment of an attorney. Victim rights legislation has been complied with.   Waiver of right to an attorney completed and submitted to the Court.  Attorney rights/advisements given.  Court finds defendant is making a knowing and voluntary waiver of right to counsel. Defendant confirms receipt of criminal complaint and waives reading.  Defendant submits three documents to the court, which Court reviews.  Corrections Officer Blake Jensen, sworn in and testified. Court finds probable cause.  Defendant bound over for trial. State to efile information that mirrors criminal complaint.  Bond continued.
Arraignment scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Public Defender Status of Counsel Report - 6 contacts

11:21 AM Defendant Matthew D Joles in court, in custody.  ADA Dennis Brown appears in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he wishes to proceed prose at this time.  Waiver of counsel form provided to defendant to complete. Defendant confirms receipt of criminal complaint.  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:10 PM Defendant Matthew D Joles appeared by video, in custody, without counsel.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has not received a copy of complaint.  State notes that a complaint was emailed to the jail to serve on defendant.  Jail serves defendant copy of complaint. Court allows time for defendant to review complaint.  Attorney rights given. Defendant will be contacting the public defender's office.  Court sets bond at $500.00 cash.  Bond form.
Initial appearance scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.
from defendant regarding programming and request for bond modification
